creator: mark_mcwilliams@hotmail.com
text:
I'm running on Solaris 9 sparc with j2sdk1.4.1_02. I run startup.sh
in $CATALINA_HOME/bin and all is well. As soon as I log out of my
unix session, tomcat dies and no servlets will work. I tried running
it nohup and in background, but same problem. I did the exact same install
on Solaris 8 without this problem. Also, I'm using  mod_jk-2.0.43 - the apache
site does not have a later version binary of this for solaris.

Please help! I have convinced a federal gov't agency to use this and I need to 
make it work.

Thanks

BZ is not a user support forum, but a place to report "confirmed" Tomcat bugs
(being we have to be able to reproduce them). For obvious problems which are
likely configuration or installation issues, it will be more efficient for you
to post on tomcat-user to get some support. Many people, including me, are
running TC as a daemon on Unix - Linux in my case - without any problems.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
This is obviously a Solaris problem, not a Tomcat problem.  I, personally, only 
have access to Solaris 8 and lower, but launching from "csh" or "nohup" with 
sh/bash works for me.

There is a chance that trying jakarta-commons/sandbox/daemon may help.  Don't 
know, haven't done it myself.
